Category: Policy, Planning & Regulation, Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Lead Queensland's Government Statistician's Office in delivering high-quality statistical and demographic research services to inform public policy and decision-making across the Queensland Government.

• Provide expert advice to senior government stakeholders.
• Manage key relationships across agencies and jurisdictions.
• Lead a professional team to deliver strategic, impactful outcomes.

Your new opportunity
Be part of shaping Queensland's future! As the Government Statistician, you'll lead the Queensland Government Statistician's Office (QGSO) in delivering cutting-edge statistical and demographic services that inform critical public policy decisions and support government priorities.

This is a unique opportunity to drive evidence-based policymaking, manage high level relationships across government and other jurisdictions, and lead a team of skilled professionals. From population forecasting to crime statistics and land supply monitoring, your work will have a direct impact on Queensland's growth and success. Join us in fostering a culture of collaboration, leadership, and innovation.

In this role, you will:

Provide expert advice and analysis to senior government stakeholders to inform public policy and strategy.
Lead the delivery of statistical analysis, official surveys, and data management systems to support evidence-based decision-making.
Oversee and manage key relationships across government agencies, departments, and jurisdictions.
Ensure compliance with State and Commonwealth legislation to uphold data integrity and management standards.
Strategically lead and allocate resources to achieve departmental and government objectives.
Foster an innovative, collaborative, and high-performing team culture aligned with government priorities.

What experience you will bring:

A proven track record of achievement in complex data analysis, economic modelling, and information systems.
Demonstrated leadership experience in large, complex organisations, with a focus on collaboration and resource sharing.
Strong expertise in strategy, policy implementation, stakeholder engagement, and client-focused service delivery.
Proven ability to lead change, build a capable workforce, and foster collaboration in challenging environments.
High-level political acumen and the ability to establish and maintain strategic relationships with senior government stakeholders.

Whilst there are no mandatory qualifications needed for this role, relevant qualifications will be highly regarded. 

How to apply
To submit your application, click on the Apply link to provide:
• Your resume detailing relevant experience
• A cover letter of no more than two pages outlining why you are interested in this position and how your knowledge, skills and experience makes you a strong candidate for the role.

Queensland Treasury is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve and treating all applicants equitably. This starts with recruitment, including making reasonable adjustments to support applicants at all stages of the process. 

We welcome applicants to share with the hiring manager any health condition, disability, and/or cultural or linguistic background, so that we may make any necessary adjustments to enable you to equitably participate in the recruitment process.

Applications to remain current for 12 months.             

Job Ad Reference: QLD/673935/25 

Closing Date: Sunday, 18 January 2026

Category: Policy, Planning & Regulation, Government - State (Government & Defence)
Ad Text:
Your new opportunity
Queensland Treasury is seeking dynamic Principal Treasury Analysts to join the newly established Financial Efficiencies team. With multiple vacancies available, this is a unique opportunity to be part of a new team and contribute to Queensland's economic recovery and long-term economic strategy. You will provide expert advice and analysis on expenditure, financial performance, and value-for-money initiatives. In this role, you will work in a complex and diverse policy environment, partnering with internal and external stakeholders to develop and oversee strategies that
achieve efficiencies in expenditure and operations across the Queensland Government. You will provide high-level advice and deliver tailored, concise, and accurate reports to support policy development and the implementation of efficiency measures.

In this role, you will:
• Provide strategic advice, information, and support to clients and senior executives regarding whole-of-government expenditure, financial performance, and related policy matters.
• Offer guidance on risk identification, management, and evaluation of best practice financial strategies and policies.
• Lead the development and implementation of processes to monitor, analyse, and interpret agencies' budget and financial information.
• Manage complex client requirements with sound judgement, authority, and influence.
• Build and maintain positive relationships with clients and stakeholders, negotiating favourable outcomes on challenging issues.
• Represent Treasury on internal and external committees and working groups, and support senior executives in ministerial briefings.
• Prepare and deliver highly complex reports, submissions, briefing notes, and correspondence within tight deadlines.
• Contribute to organisational strategy, direction, and initiatives.

What experience you will bring:
To excel in this role, you will demonstrate:
• Experience in analysing and interpreting financial and non-financial performance data and/or developing government policy.
• Strong research and analytical skills to provide expert, strategic, and solutions-oriented advice on policy and governance issues.
• Influential communication skills tailored to diverse audiences.
• Highly developed interpersonal and relationship management skills that foster collaboration and information sharing.
• Effective judgement and the ability to understand differing perspectives when developing solutions and working with others.
Whilst there are no mandatory qualifications needed for this role, relevant qualifications will be highly regarded.

How to apply
To submit your application, click on the Apply link to provide:
• Your resume detailing relevant experience
• A cover letter of no more than two pages outlining why you are interested in this position and how your knowledge, skills and experience makes you a strong candidate for the role.

Queensland Treasury is committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce that reflects the community we serve and treating all applicants equitably. This starts with recruitment, including making reasonable adjustments to support applicants at all stages of the process.

We welcome applicants to share with the hiring manager any health condition, disability, and/or cultural or linguistic background, so that we may make any necessary adjustments to enable you to equitably participate in the recruitment process.


Applications to remain current for 12 months

Job Ad Reference: QLD/673993/25

Closing Date: Sunday, 11 January 2026
